page.title: 01RHYD-Y-FRO AND DISTRICT
page.content: We live in a rural area. The village is called Rhydyfro. This is a Welsh name.{Rhyd}means ford and {bro} means valley. At one time people had to cross from one side of the valley to the other by a ford. Rhydyfro is a small village with few amenities, only two shops. The nearest town is Pontardawe a mile away. The nearest city is Swansea which is nine miles away. The village is situated in a narrow valley.The Upper Clydach river flows through and joins the Tawe lower down. On the sides of the valley there is woodland, heath and grazing land. There is some dairy farming but most farmers keep sheep. In the valley coal-mining is the main industry. There is a large mine at Abernant about one mile away.
